text: Rich multi slightly sweet and balanced and very smooth. Slight hint of strength good finish. Excellent example of Baltic Porter.
750 ml bottle shared, thanks solidfunk! Dark brownish with light tan head. Aromas of roast, licorice. Tastes of roast, dark chocolate, licorice. Medium body with a dry finish.
Roast and dark chocolate. Caramel. Black pour with good head and lacing. Bittersweet beer. Good balance and welk done for style without going crazy like Gaga.

From a bottle shared at the DC RB gathering Memorial Day weekend 2017. A huge thanks to Josh! It is a cola Cole with a tan head. The Aroma of bourbon. And the taste is caramel, bourbon and oak. Sweet but delicious.

From a bottle shared at the DC RB gathering Memorial Day weekend 2017. A huge thanks to Josh! Pours a clear cola with a tan head. Aroma of bourbon. Flavors of caramel, bourbon and oak. Sweet but delicious.
Tap at Brasserie V. Foamy beige head. Brown black body. All sorts of barrel tones, including some infection, which wipes away any subtle tones. The beer is lost, infection overtaken it.

Bottle... This beer rocks! Pours black with a small, creamy, off-white head that eventually gives way to a small, tight collar. The aroma is both toasty and fruity - the liquors really come to the forefront here. Medium to full-bodied with busy carbonation. Toasty and moderately sweet with enjoyable bourbon and brandy flavor. Not intensely boozy. As with all LTM beers, this recipe is thoughtfully planned and perfectly executed. Quietly, this is one of the most consistent and talented craft breweries on the planet. Thanks to the guys in the Palm Beach County crew for sharing this world-class beer!

Bottle thanks to Dan at Leightons 20k tasting. It pours black with a decent tan head. The aroma is rich, toasty, bitter - sweet, wood, leather, coffee grounds, coffee cake, brandy, booze and vanilla. The taste is toasty, earthy, wood, leather, dried fruit, eccles cake, roasted malt, boozy warmth, coffee cake,cocoa, dark chocolate, brandy, bourbon, damp wood and leather with a warming finish. Full body and moderate - high carbonation. A pretty rich and chewy/toothy baltic porter. Decent.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2017 Brilliant. A lot of barrel, mostly burboun, brandy in alcoholic aftertaste. A little nail polish. Very rich taste with prums, raisins, chocolates, pralines. A bit of soy sauce and alcoholic burn. Quite taninic. Work of art.
Świetna, intensywna praca beczki, znakomicie ułożone. Czekolada, paloność, sos sojowy, ciemne owoce. Na pewno kiedyś powtórzę.

Corked 75 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are bourbon, brandy, dried fruit, vanilla, tobacco, and liquorice - with a smooth finish. ABV is well hidden

Black, average head. Aroma: tons of coconut, vanilla and barrell notes, chocolate, some malt. Full body, medium to heavy sweetness, medium to low bitterness. Again lots of burbon barrel, mainly coconut, but also its very alcoholic
Overall marvelous aroma, but hard-drinking.

Bottle 0.75l shared at Foeders Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 24.03.2017. Taste with Potjebier and Maakun. Pour it dark color with small brown head. Aroma vanilla, woody, licorice. Taste light sweet milky chocolate, bourbon on the back, woody dusty barrel notes, leather, nice smooth thick finish, full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish. Nice!
On tap at BBF. Black colour with tan head. Wood, brandy aroma. Sweet, wood, vanilla, caramel and chocolate taste. Medium to full body.
Tirador al BBF17. Cervesa fosca amb poca escuma. Aromes dolços de xocolata amb final àcid que recorda als fruits vermells. Cos mig-baix, carbonatació baixa. Molt bona!

Bottle, shared @ Foeders with Markoijelena & Maakun, thanks Maarten! Color is as good as black. Rather dense beige head. Aromas: boozy, brandy and whiskey, fruity and vanilla, sweetish. Retronasal its fruity sourish, boozy/alcoholic, sweetish, woody. Flavor is moderate to full sweet, alcoholic. Medium to full bodied. Nice one.

Bottle shared. Black with light brown head. Lots of bourbon, fruity brandy, lots of chocolate, fudge, vanilla, coconut, instant coffee, black berries, caramel. Very sweet and some boozy bitterness. Over medium bodied with slick feel. Great!

March 1st 2017Leightons 20K at his posh new gaff! Thanks to Dan. Hazy deep brown beer, good tan head. Palate is airy and soft, reasonable fine carbonation. Soft dark malts, little dark chocolate. Smooth coffee. Light bourbon and well integrated brandy. Smooth soft finish shows a little spice. Very nice.

St Davids Day 2017 - Cork and cage bottle share at Leightons 20K. Many congrats! As Les Trois Mousquetaires G.C. Porter Baltique Cuvee Speciale Bourbon & Brandy, 2015 vintage, 10.5%. Pours opaque black with a foamy brown head, leaving full lacing. Aroma is dark chocolate, brandy, molasses and earth. Body is a touch frothy with tingly carbonation. Taste is rich but not too sweet, chocolate malts, nice balance between the brandy and bourbon  both noticeable but neither overtaking, vanilla and coffee, earthy spicy finish. I found the base beer too sweet and simple but this version is excellent. (4.2)

50cl bottle shared at Leightons Penthouse for his 20K. Special thanks to Daniel for this beer. It pours a clean brown color with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet roasty and sweet with notes of bourbon, coffee, vanilla, chocolate. Taste is also very sweet and rich with notes of vanilla, coffee, caramel, roasted wood. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very good

Bottle shared in London for the 20k - big thanks to Daniel. Pours black-brown with a creamy tan head. Good roast in the nose, dried fruits, chocolate, burnt wood. Medium sweet flavour with somewhat creamy chocolate, mellow roast, more dried berries, dates. Medium bodied with massaging carboantion. Smooth finish, minimal heat, gooey chocolate, raisins, more figs. Super smooth. Impressive.

Bottle shared at the Leighton mega 20k tasting. 1/03/2017. Many thanks to Daniel for this one. A clear dark mahogany brown coloured pour with a lasting mid tan head. Aroma is smooth cakey roast, bourbon, oak, vanilla. Flavour is composed of sweet cakey malts, roasted coconut, sweet burnt brown sugars, cakey, bitter roast in the finish. Palate is medium full, frothy carbonation, oily. Lingering coconut, brandy, oaky bourbon. Good stuff.

Sergeys hunt, Oct 2016, 9-4-8-4-17=42The bourbon adds a nice tobacco touch to the aroma. Smooth and round flavor, nice malt depth, hints of bourbon, spirits, roasted nuts, and more chocolate.Excellent.Sergeys hunt, brewed Oct 2015, 8-4-8-4-16=40Compared to the 2016, this is thinner, apparently less sweet, and the spirit is more prominent, brandy.Sergeys hunt, brewed Oct 2014, 8-4-7-4-16=39Nice aroma, with Bourbon, nice chocolate, but a bit too boozy.

Édition 2016, Bouteille 750m. La bouteille laisse tomber somptueux liquide noir et opaque, coiffée dune mousse crémeuse brûnatre. Au nez, il y a tellement de chose à décrire, cest sucré, vanillé, boisé, le malt caramel, le chocolat noir, fruits foncés séchés, les spiritueux, spécialement le bourbon. En bouche, cest délectable, on se dit que cest probablement la meilleure porter quon ait bu. Tout est sublime et bien balancé, le caramel, le chocolat noir, la touche dalcool fort qui nous réchauffe légèrement la gorge, la barrique. Elle a vraiment une belle texture et cache très bien son jeu de 10.5%. Je le répète, cest sublime, on dirait être tout près de la perfection.

2016 Vintage
Dark as coal. Not one beam of light passes through. Brown thick foamy head. Aromas of sweet sugary fruits, roasted malt and dark chocolate. Similar taste, lighter on the roast. Nice bourbon/brandy alcohol feeling. Some nutty touches. Medium creamy body, nice carbonation. Might be biased a bit though, as barred-aged beers, especially porters, always taste like heaven to me.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, coconuts
Appearance-brown, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

750ml bottle @ home(thanks Sergiy). 2016 Vintage
Pours black with a small tan head. Nose is light bourbon and hints of caramel malts. Flavour is caramel, raisins, bourbon, and malty. Quite tasty!

750ml bottle @ home(thanks Sergiy). 2015 Vintage
Pours black with a small tan head. Nose is sweet, smooth, hints of bourbon, and dark fruits. Flavour is a touch hotter than the 2016 and the sweetness isnt a pronounced.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2017 At Brians during special LTM beers tasting. 750ml bottles.
Vintage 2016 from the brewery (thx, Alex M.!). Pours an almost black with a dark beige head. Aroma is woody, bourbon, some cherry, woody and dark fruits notes. Taste is pretty the same. Good stuff.
8-4-8-4-16=40
Vintage 2015 from Firefly Cambie. Pours an almost black with a dark beige head. Aroma is bourbon (much more than in 2016), some dark fruits, some woody, but no cherry notes. Taste is bourbon, some boozy notes, slightly woody. Like this one more, then fresh because of much more bourbon character.
8-4-8-4-17=41
Vintage 2014 (thx, Louis-Philippe!). Pours an almost black with a dark beige head. Aroma is bourbon, dark fruits, some boozy notes. Taste is pretty the same. Something like between 2015 and 2016. More fruity than 2015, but less than 2016. Less bourbon than 2015, but much more than in 2016.
8-4-8-4-16=40

Conclusion: the 1 year old porter baltic barrel aged is the best option for me.

Bottle 2015. Dark brown color with fine tan foam. Rich aroma: bourbon and brandy, vanilla, alcohols, caramel and other malts, dried fruit, smoked prunes, blue raisins, barrel, oxidation and a bit of fennel. Very powerful malty taste, vanilla, cognac, prunes, maple sugar, port wine, a little nuts, tannins, very warming, a bit smoked and little chocolate. Great beer.

Une bière noire, avec deux gros doigts de mousse, à la robe opaque. Au nez, chocolat noir, mélasse, toffee, caramel et alcool. La bouche est impressionnante, avec dabord beaucoup de chocolat noir, ce qui rend le goût de ce porter bien onctueux. Vient en deuxième plan le malt torréfié, donnant un gout de café subtil, contrebalancé par une présence alcoolisée bien calibrée. Le vieillissement en barriques donne un petit aperçu boisé quon cherche un peu, mais quon trouve en fin de bouche. Le corps riche cache probablement un peu trop bien les 10% de cette bière. Porter fort bien réussi, on se demande ce qui pourrait être mieux fait dans ce brassin.

As Trois Mousquitares Porter Baltique Edition Especial. Draft at Coopers. Brown pour, small light brown head. Roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, booze. Barrel flavor for sure. Solid booziness. Heavy and smooth. Nice stuff.

0.75L bottle, 2015 vintage (from saveur-biere). Pours black. Aroma is sweet, malt, smoke, bourbon, vanilla, raisins, brandy. Flavor is sweet and bitter, fruits, brandy, raisins, vanilla, bourbon, roast. Finish is roast, raisins, bourbon and dry bitterness. Overall: great brew. From the aroma it looked like the beer will be beer mixed with brandy and bourbon, but its actually very smooth and complex stuff, not boozy at all. Barrel aging done right!

Bouteille 02/10/2014

Le chocolat plein le nez. Une torréfaction surprenante. Une douceur du bourbon et de brandy me fait chavirer les narines. 

Couleur noire qui tend vers le rouge vin, avec une mince mousse soyeuse brunâtre. Un peu de particule de lie dans le verre.

Dès lentrée en bouche, une fondu bien chocolaté nous amène droit dans la douceur du bourbon, de la torréfaction. Cest doux, caramélisant, tendre. Un très léger soupçon dalcool fait remonter la chaleur rustique du poêle à bois. Des notes de noisettes et chocolat viennent finalisé cette merveille à chaque gorgée! 

World Class!

Mindig lenyűgöző élményt jelent annak megtapasztalása, hogy mennyire tökéletes alanyként szolgál a sör egy másféle alkohol alapjául, mennyire remekül passzol a különféle italok lenyomata különösen a testesebb, fekete főzetek karakteréhez. Az az eset azonban, amikor ez a benyomás nem egy hagyományosan érlelésre teremtett, felsőerjesztésű sör esetében ér minket, még különlegesebb, izgalmakkal teli perceket ígérő. Ha ehhez foghatóan fenomenális illatokat érzünk, ahhoz a legtöbb esetben whiskey-nek, konyaknak van köze, ez esetben a bourbon és a brandy jótékony, 6 hónapos pártfogásának az eredménye a sziporkázó illatáradat. A vanília, alkoholban ázott fahordó, mogyoró átütő erejű illatai nem éppen balti portertől megszokottak: csodákra képes az érlelés, nem győzöm ismételni. Ízvilága bár összetett, tartalmas és izgalmas, lager-mivoltát nemigen tagadhatja, a szerkezete talán nem az igazi mélységek otthona, nem az a végtelen karakter. Ennyit talán a panaszokról, melyek csak abban az esetben merülhetnek fel, ha valamit nagyon a terhére szeretnénk róni a kanadai főzetnek, ennél azonban jóval emlékezetesebb benyomást hagy maga után rumos csokoládés, csokoládéfagylaltos, marcipános-karamellás, inkább ízre, mint állagra szirupos jellege, bársonyos, melengető karaktere, prémium minőségű, nemes alkoholok képét idéző szerkezete. Az eddigi legjobb balti porter, amelyhez pályafutásom során szerencsém volt.
(cask) clear, very dark brown colour with small, brown head; aroma of soy sauce, jam, dried fruit; thick palate; balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish
Bottle. Dark brown pour a mocha head. Nice boozy bouquet. Smooth with tasty bourbon and brandy highlights that give way to malts, caramel, and oak. Above average body and mouthfeel.

Bottle 75 cl. Vintage 2014. Pours an opaque black with a quickly dissipating beige head. Very sweet Bourbon/vanilla aroma atop some sweet malts. Rich, filling body, has a slight dustiness in the malts. Sweet, dark malts, dard dried fruits, molasses and then the vanilla/Bourbon sweetness returns. Booze completely hidden, this is like drinking pop! 290916

750ml bottle purchased on site. Pours black liquidy, with a light high rising foamy head. Sweet coconutty brandy scent with roasted coffee and cocoa. Sweet coconut taste with cocoa and roasted coffee beans. VERY smooth, almost like velvet in your mouth. Light, watery mouthfeel as a porter should have as compared to a stout. Delicious.

750 ml. bottle. Thanks Mike! Pours black with a nice tan head. Aroma of malt, bourbon, chocolate, and dark fruit. Taste is roasted malt, bourbon, chocolate, dark fruit, vanilla, and brandy. Very complex, very delicious.

Black pour with a ruby hue and a thin beige head ... aroma of dark fruits, brandy, oak, smoke, licorice and light roasted malts  .... taste is of smoke, oak, brandy, dark fruits, licorice, roasted malts, light chocolate, caramel malts, some whiskey ..... light vanilla notes ... very dry, oaky and balanced .... some booze and warming with a lingering smoky brandy flavor .... complex and balanced ... intense brew
Whelming, given the price and how much I like the base beer. The barrel kinda mucks up the delicious fruity complexity without adding a whole lot of qualiy flavors.
Bottle @ home, thanks Aaron! Pitch black pour with a generous tan head. Tons of caramel, fudge, smooth vanilla, coconut, brrbn, sweet malts, milk chocolate and light ash. Very good!

Apparence : Brune très foncée, noire, reflets brunâtres, effervescence semble moyenne, bon col brun, rétention appropriée, légère dentelle. 
Nez : Chocolat sucré à la vanille, fruits rouges (cerises), boisé, sucre grillé, légères notes dalcool. Bonne intensité, complexe et équilibré. 
Goût : Chocolat sucré, mêmes fruits rouges, boisé, alcool qui se pointe en finale. Plutôt sucrée, légère amertume. Intensité élevée. 
Sensation : Corps assez dense, effervescence moyenne, belle chaleur de lalcool, piquant sur la langue et au palais. Longue finale chaleureuse, grillée et boisée. 
O : Multidimensionnelle, équilibrée, intense, excellente que demander de plus? 
Le vieillissement en fût est sans faille, aucune fausse note ou acidité mal placée. Elle est traître car on peut en boire assez avant de se rendre compte quelle contient 10,5%!

lightish black pour. Aroma is mild dark malt, touch of brandy and big booze. Taste is sweet spirit, bourbon, brandy and a crazy level oxidation (too much for me). Spirit is the big winner here, but not much of the base beer shines because of the barrel plus oxidation. Shame because the base beer is a winner.

Pours black with a large tan head.
Nose shows coconut, woody oak, vanilla, roasted malt and chocolate.
Flavours include bourbon, vanilla, woody oak, milk chocolate. A fair bit of sweetness, works well.

Bottle, 750 ml at Olhops. Courtesy of and shared with Francisco from Olhops. Huge thanks! Pours black with small tan head. Roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, dark fruit, vanilla, wood, bourbon. Low carbonation, oily. Complex yet ery balanced and smooth, alcohol well hidden, really impressive.

750 ml corked and caged bottle, no dating on it that I noticed. Served in a DFH snifter, the beer pours dark brown/black with about an inch tan head. Head retention and lacing are both good. I like the aroma a lot, the brew smells like dark chocolate, roasted malt, dark fruit, vanilla, bourbon and brandy. The taste is similar to the aroma, but theres also some nuttiness, molasses and grainy malt flavors noticeable too. Mouthfeel/body is medium/full, its creamy and a bit coating with a good amount of carbonation. I remember liking their regular Porter Baltique a lot, and this one is just as good if not better. Its definitely worth picking up! $19.49 a bottle.

Vraiment tout ce quil y a à espérer dune bière de cette qualité.
Nez ultra bourbon, peu éthylique, assez chocolaté, fond café si lon sattarde sur les notes noix de coco. Très gourmand.
Bouche classique mais parfaite : attaque ronde, chocolatée et caramélisée, légèrement boisée. Finale ultra bourbon, les notes de brandy sont très subtiles. La longueur est plutôt chaude, gourmande, très bourbon.
Bel équilibre, belle buvabilité.

Bouteille de 750ml de la version 2014. Liquide dun noir surmontée dune fine mousse moka. Boisé, bourbon, chocolat, tout y est bien balancé pour nous donner un produit unique, le top du genre au Québec et de loin.

750 ml bottle, huge thanks to willrunforbeer on his number 2000 rate !!! This is a 2014 vintage. Deep brown / black color, nice head retention in the chalice. Aroma is a wonderful blend of bourbon, dark fruit, light chocolate and still a great level of brandy character! 
The flavor is simply wonderful. The base Porter has a great roasted malt and earthy grain base. The profile starts with a steady amount Brandy up front with hints of coconut and vanilla. The bourbon is noticed in the finish. The two years of sitting has mellowed the beer so it shows no alcohol whatsoever. Cant be noticed at all. Incredible smoothness. Creamy texture, gosh this is beautiful.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2016 Poured from bottle 4/10/14 thanks Willrunforbeer #2000 whalezz son dark clear black with a nice tan head and good lacing. Aromas of brandy dark fruit cocoa vanilla and oak. Taste is smooth and creamy alcohol is hidden nice brandy up front followed by vanilla dark fruit. Quite the nice brew.

Rate #2000! 750ml bottle shared with AirForceHops and Chalumeaux. Weve had a lot of good beers together. Got this bottle in an in person trade with Luc before last years EBF. Thanks! Bottle date 04/10/14. Pours coca cola brown with a beige head. Aroma is dark chocolate, molasses, brandy, char. Flavor is smooth, dark chocolate, molasses, date, light brandy, light bourbon. A hint of vanilla oak in the finish. 10.5% well hidden. Quite nice, I can see why this is a top Baltic Porter.

Pours black with a large tan head. Aroma is vanilla, oak & brandy. Taste is sweet with a brandy-esque bite that goes to smooth vanilla and dark dried fruits with a creamy finish. Best lagered beer Ive had, no doubt. Too bad the monopolies never could make one like this.

Bottle, 2013 thanks to Gikinji~~ Pours deep clear black, small tan head, dissipates to a ring with some lacing. Aroma is rich, cocoa, bourbon, molasses, anise, oak tannin. Flavor follows, medium sweet, light plus bitter, some heat, rich molasses and anise from the baltic porter, chocolate notes, bourbon brings vanilla and of course bourbon. Medium plus body, somewhat creamy. This is a pretty rock solid beer.
750 ml bottle from Tavour. Nose is chocolate, char, blackberries, and a hint of vanilla. Black with a big heavy lacing tan head. Flavor is lightly sweet, fruity, and chocolaty. Nice.

(750ml bottle, 2013 vintage) Pour a black body with a small tan head. Aroma of raisins, dates, roasted grain, bourbon, and caramel. Flavor of roasted grain, bourbon, brandy, molasses, caramel, chocolate, grain, oak, and raisins.

dark brown colour, one inch creamy light brown head, which lasts for several minutes; aroma of coffee, chocolate, dried plum and sour cherry, some peat, whisky and herbal liqueur notes; taste is the same - amazing baltic porter!

750ml bottle. Deep black. Good amount of light brown head. Nose is brandy, fig, plum, molasses, liquorice, golden syrup. Smooth, rich taste. Barrels come through well in the finish. Leans more towards the brandy side than bourbon. Great drinkability for such a big beer. Top stuff.

Bottle from Bacco. Pours pitch black with a two-finger amber head. Smells of peaty bourbon and burned cherries. Not as thick as I prefer in a porter, but picking nits. Nice chocolate notes with a tongue-numbing brandy finish. Drink at room temperature. Very well done.

750 mL bottle. Black body. Smell is strong barrel. Lots of brandy. Smells sweet. Coconut. Milk chocolate. Taste also has a lot of coconut. Brandy behind it. Chocolate and some roasted malt. I dont get much bourbon, though. Oaky finish. Much better than the regular version. At least my bottle.

Thanks Dominic!!!! Wonderful beer. Pours a dark black with stiff tan head. Aromas of smoke, dark fruit, maple, bourbon, sweet brandy. Boozy flavours that carry notes of maple, grapes, smoke, umami. Sweet and decadent.

Thanks cards04 for sharing. Dark brown body foamy off white head and nice lacing. Sweet malty dried fruit, booze, lactose, a touch of plastic in the aroma. Taste is rich sweet dark roast malts dried fruit and bourbon. Frothy tingly palate. In some ways this seems as much like a Belgian ale as s Baltic Porter. Really nice.

5 years later another Trois Mousquetaires baltic porter, another world, another life really. Sure, so what - somehow I found a bottle in travels in some big city, brought it back to the not-so-big-city and sat on it for awhile. Thought it may have been the same that I tried so long ago in Mo-Ral, but it aint, its different so they say. Pours with disappearing head at 11.7 celcius and ruby-black body, good but not perfect. Aroma of licorice, candy, polished leather, oil soaked Australian rain coats. Flavour is beef jerky, smoked rhubarb, cherry cola, molasses infused brandy. Cloying is the only serious complaint which means this is a serious sipping brew. Good to revisit an old friend and I sure as hell wont remember too much tomorrow once this bottle is done - dont ask me to operate any of your heavy equipment please. tx.

Pours dark with a beige head. Sweet to the nose. Can smell the bourbon and brandy influence. Oily mouthfeel with some sweetness. Bourbon comes out more on the swallow with a touch of bittersweetness. Taste lingers for a good while, pleasantly. Very warming. More of a sipper, better to savor it. Nice.

Pitch black and red edge. Hazy. Smells fantastic. Chocolate chip cookie, vanilla and wafers. Incredible moUth feel. Creaky viscous. Super sweet. Loafs of brandy and vanilla. Huge, Cookie, cream. Caramel. Boozes fiber. Wow.

750 ml bottle from a small dépanneur in Gatineau.
Appearance: Pours jet black with no light coming through. Has a few fingers of tan head with good retention.
Aroma:
Bourbon, coffee, licorice.
Flavours:
Bourbon, moca, molasses, some tobacco and vanilla.
Mouthfeel:
Thicker coating mouthfeel. Average carbonation.
Overall: Nice Baltic Porter with interesting oak characteristics like tobacco and vanilla coming through.
Sehr dunkel braune Farbe, schöner brauner Schaum. Geruch intensiv röstmalzig, holzig, Whiskey. Geschmack sehr süß, röstmalzig, rote Früchte, holzig, weich, toll!

Marrom escura, opaca. Espuma bege média de média duração. Aroma de defumado e baunilha. Sabor de baunilha, defumado, amadeirado, ameixa seca, café, alcaçuz e conhaque. Retrogosto adocicado, alcoólico, com final de café.

750ml corked bottle pours black in color with a finger of light brown head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is dark fruit with some chocolate and licorice, bourbon and brandy notes as well. Taste is of bourbon and brandy with a dark fruit and chocolate malty sweetness with a light roasted grain and spicy bitterness. Full bodied with good carbonation that pleases the palate. Overall, a well balanced brew that hides the alcohol quite well and tastes great. Recommended.

Dégusté dans la même soirée que lanporter baltique régulière, la comparaison est vraiment interessante. La édition special est vraiment moins café et beaucoup plus fruit sauvage avec une touche de vanille très douce. Jadore!

Bottle @ Deans Sticky Bomb Shelter Tasting, thnx to me for sharing! 2013 vintage. Side by side with regular Porter Baltique of same vintage. Pours a pitch black beer with a thin brown, creamy head on top. Aroma of massive molasses, loads of bourbon, loads of oak and loads of bourbon. Bassically a massive aroma bomb, incredibly well balanced. Flavor is very sweet, loads of characters of the base beer with hints of licorice and dark chocolate. The barrel treatments are amazing in this one. Sweet, boozy notes of bourbon combined with fruity, rich notes of the brandy. Slight hint of chocolate vanilla in the base completes this beer in an epic way. Very sticky and sweet, greatly balanced and just an amazing beer!

Thanks to Mrhangover! 750 ml. bottle sampled @ Deans sticky Bomb Shelter Tasting. Black, almost no head. Nose is big perfect mix of licorice, maple, huge brandy, vanilla, sugar, barrel, absolutely perfect mix. Taste is huge vanilla, sweet bourbon, barrel, sugar, raisins, candy, vanilla, brandy, vanilla, thick barrel, coffee, berries, Amazingly thick, syrupy, harmonious, barrel character is out of this world. Wow this is so good. Why is this not better known? Or maybe better keep it this way. This is too good for people to hoard.

Bottle shared thanks to Mrhangover. Pours black with a small beige head. Aroma of dark chocolate, roast, bourbon, oak, brandy showing up too, caramel, light cola and malt. Flavour is light heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

750ml 2015 bottle from brewery... for some reason I never rated that bottle that I drank a few times already. Aroma: nice bourbon barrel aroma mixed with chocolate and coffee. App: pitch dark but with some brown tint. Medium beige brown head with awesome lacing and great retention. Taste and palate: full body, creamy, smooth, medium sweetness but a tad bitter and alcool warming finish. Overall: so great. Every year this beer gets me even more proud of the Quebec beer scene. So smooth.
Les notes de fûts sont un peu trop présente et persistante pour moi, malgré tout cest une des mes plus préférences les plus tenaces.

Porter Baltique Édition Spéciale 2015; Couleur noire comme la nuit, un mince col de mousse beige couronne ce liquide opaque, toutfois il disparait très rapidement. Des arômes de chocolat noir se dégage de la bière. Au goût, il y a du chocolat de la vanille, des noix ainsi que des saveurs boisées. Le liquide est huileux et il possède un corps onctueux et riche. Lalcool est très peu perceptible au goût si ce nest quil réchauffe la gorge. Une bière qui est très facile à boire, avec un goût exeptionnel.
Porter baltique édition 2013: arômes puissant boisé, le côté bourbon est plus présent que brandy, chocolaté. Saveur boisé, chocolaté, réglisse noir vraiment superbe

75 cl bottle @ Timo A. Production date 03.10.2014.
Pours dark red, almost black color with a small head. Bourbon is quite forward on the aroma, black currant, some vanilla and subtle honey notes. Sweet ripe fruits, dark berries and caramel on the flavor, mild espresso notes with toffee on the finish. Simply; lovely.
5426

750 ml bottle. #2014. Bottled on 3/10/14.
Merci a Timo de A!
Dark brown color with a small grayish tan head.
Roasted malt, ash, dryness, mild alcohol and bourbon in the aroma.
The flavor is bourbon, sweetness, roasted malt, dark fruits, mild berriness and more sweetness. Rich! Tasty and balanced!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I love the original product, always been one of my favorites. This one a 2013 edition that I found at pub BreWskeys is amazing. You can really taste the barrel in the beer. Well worth the try

750 ml bottle shared by b3shine 2014 Vintage. Pours a dark cola brown color with a medium sized creamy beige head. The aroma and flavor had mildly roasted malts, ample dark fruits that favor cherry, hazelnut, bourbon, vanilla, brandy comes through at well, light smoke character, sweet nutty notes, lots going on, I had the base years ago and it was too long to really compare well in my brain, but this seemed like an interesting treatment.

750 ml bottle shared by b3shine - thanks again, Beau! 2014 vintage. Pours a cloudy cocoa brown with a small beige head that settles into a ring and a thin, wispy film that never vanishes. Streaks of lace adorn the glass. The bourbon and brandy barrels are big here, but the base beer really shies into the background. Vanilla, caramel, brown sugar, oak, dark fruits, cookies, and pralines. But honestly, DrSilverworm says it best - theres a dry, sugary, nutty sweetness, like a hazelnut and marzipan thing going on. I had a hard time placing it; he nailed it. Medium-bodied, with a sweet, boozy (bordering on phenolic), dry mouthfeel. Moderate carbonation. Not the most graceful barrel aging; Id be curious to try the base beer alone.

750ml bottle, shared by b3shine. Bottled 2/10/2014, it looks like. Clear brown color, slight red. Thin kind of khaki / tan head, some bits and short ropes of lace. Caramel malt up front, some dark fruit, interesting kind of dessert-liquor character. Moderate to bigger sweet taste, lighter bitter. Touch of warmth on the end. Complex aroma. Nice desert-like nuttiness, marzipan, hazelnut. Tasty milk chocolate to mild dark chocolate action. Nice stuff, in that canadian sort of way.

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared with the group; thanks DuffMan). Looks good; a translucent brownish cola with fizzy light beige head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells good too; dark malt, chocolate, oak, and whiskey. Tastes like it smells with a touch of lager yeast as well. Mouthfeel is medium full-bodied and pleasant. Good stuff.

Bottle to tulip, rated with the standard G.C. Porter
Molasses, red bell pepper, wine, malts, and a little booze. Reddish brown with a thin, light tan head. Taste is bourbon, wine, wood (oak?), and malt.

At bottle sharing the RBSG. .Poured black with tan head. Nose of roasted malts, anise, and vanilla. Bold in body with a alcoholic mouthfeel. Flavor is dark ripe fruit, alcohol, and vanilla. Really rich and decadent. Superb.
Bottle @ ZEBF 2015. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and vanilla booze. Taste has coffee, red fruit, vanilla and roast. Nice BA porter.

Bottle @ Eastside Lodge. Thanks, Tony. Black in color with a big tan head. Roasted malts and a lot of oak. Theres a lot of vanilla, some licorice, and burnt sugar. Some booze soaked fruits, whiskey, and caramel. A nice sweetness to it of vanilla, dark fruit, and whiskey. Slight brandy fruitiness as well. A little char and ash on the finish.

Bottle thanks to Duffman, RBSG-PDX 
Dark brown with a medium sized tan head, good lacing. Aroma of toasted malts and woody. Taste of toasted malts, woody, caramel and some hot alcohol  
Good

Big thanks to Duffman! Cant breathe!

A: Pitch black body, creme colored head.

N: Milk chocolate, toast, roast, caramel, vanilla, brandy, bourbon, soaked cherries.

T: Nicely balanced even with the big barreling presence - though with sweetness against char. 

M: Medium body, creamy carbonation, distinct lack of alcohol.

O: I really enjoy the base, and the barrels work really well here. I might dial back the sweetness a bit more, but thats a minor quibble - because I thought the base was so good with the smokiness.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and really small brown head. Smell: roasted malt, caramel, sugar and barrel aged. Amazing complexity. Taste: not so dense palate, coffee and roasted malt. Caramel and sugar cane notes. Very nice!!! Aftertaste: caramel and sweet with coffee and roasted malt.

Wow, superbe bière. Un peu forte et costaude mais pure délice en bouche. Dun noire opaque et une superbe mousse délicieuse! Avis, dispendieuse mais si connaisseur cette bière peu se garder comme une bonne bouteille de vin et être bu 2-3-4-5 ans après !!! Dommage quelle est introuvable maintenant avoir su à lépoque jen aurais acheter plus !

On tap at Festibiere. This is virtually identical to the regular 2014 version, but with faint notes of oak and bourbon and brandy. Id rank this higher than the OG if there was a bit more barrel-aging character, but this is still ludicrously good stuff. Dark chocolate and cherries, molasses, liquorice, toast, coffee, plus a bit of leftover barrel booze. So drinkable for such a heavy, intense beer.
Nose of booze and smoked malt. Full mouthful of roasted malt. Alcohol is well hidden. Nice though I prefer the regular more.

2014 édition. A deep dark stout with a thin creamy brown head. In aroma, beautiful sweet fruity chocolate malt with light coffee, licorice notes, molasses, light peated notes. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity chocolate malt with light coffee, molasses, vanilla extract, complex and beautiful, very nice. On tap at Festibière de Gatineau 2015.

[7018-20141231] Bottle. Thick fruity plum aroma has a malty undertone. Hazy, dark brown mahogany body with a medium-lasting foamy off-white head. Medium-full body. Good, sessionable. (8/4/9/4/16) 4.1
(@ Volo, Toronto, ON)
Bottle. Aroma is nice, roasty, lots of booze, whisky, cocoa. Taste is good, fruity, finish is dry and chocolatey, little bit of bitterness. Lovely. Sweet caramel. Smooth.

Pours nice dark brown, bit of beige foam. Aroma is surprisingly spicy, bit of roast but malts and toffee also there. Taste is sweet and smooth as milk chocolate. Bit peppery, a bitter bite also there, nicely balanceed. Smooth. Bit of booze bite coming through from the bourbon barrel.

Dark brown color. Sweet malty nose with cane sugar, chocolate bon bons, molasses, rounded. Alcohol well hidden. But Brandy is not so so present. Lots of molasses and cane sugar linger in the finish. Very nice stuff, but I cant say super exceptional.

Bottle, shared at post-festival party. Very dark brown with a rocky tan head. Big bourbon aroma with underlying dark fruits and brown bread. Bold barrel character in balance with sweet dark malts, lots of bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, wood. Terrific balance here, very full bodied. I dont know how its possible that a beer of this size and body can be so drinkable, but it is. Fantastic.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: UPDATED: MAR 8, 2015 750 ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown with moderate tan head. Aromas of smoky dark chocolate, bourbon, and coffee. Flavors of roasted malt and flat bourbon. Missing the richness of the base porter. Too long in the barrel(s)?

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2015 Édition 2014. Nez de bourbon, chocolat, bois et alcool. En bouche, le goût de brandy prend le dessus. Suivent des saveurs de chocolat, anis, cerises et café. Ces saveurs, quoique un peu trop sucrées, forment tout de même un bel équilibre. Le liquide est crémeux et doux en bouche. Le haut taux dalcool procure une belle chaleur. La finale est sucrée, douce et modérée. Faible présence des houblons. Très bonne bière en général. À boire lentement, laissez-la réchauffer pour en apprécier toutes les subtilités. À faire également vieillir pour peut-être voir les saveurs se complexifiées. 

Edition 2013, bue après 26 mois. Robe noire avec de minces reflets noisettes. Aucun col de mousse et faible effervescence. Arômes de léger madère (mûres, cerises noires, dattes grillées), café noir, chocolat sucré. Le bourbon se marie à merveille le sucre résiduel de la porter baltique tout de même bien présent. Le brandy semble plus effacé, sauf de minces effluves épicées. Le haut taux dalcool est caché. Nez dune intensité monstre et dune complexité extrême. En bouche, bourbon, sucre brun, chocolat et vanille. Notes de cappuccino glacé, baies confites, brandy aux fruits. Quelques saveurs grillées mais subtiles dans lensemble. Un équilibre quasi sans faille et aucun goût dalcool. Belle texture huileuse et rondeur incroyable. 9/3/9/5/18 = 4.4/5

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2015 Aroma is deep rich malts, caramel, molasses, brown sugar and a host of pleasant dark fruits. Taste is a deep maltiness with a full palate of dark sweet fruits and sweet bourbon and brandy flavors that give some nice liquor warmth that isn?t dominant or overpowering. Finishes with a light and well balanced hoppiness that goes down smoothly. Appearance is a dark black body with a medium beige head that retains well.
Magnificent imperial porter, the bourbon imparting more than cognac. Very smooth mouthfeel. Wonderful drinkability.

Negro opaco y espuma beis compacta. Aromas intenso y equilibrados de chocolate, bourbon, brandy, frutos , manzana dulce y madera. Cuerpo medio, inició dulce de bourbon y achocolatado intenso que deja paso a un sabor afeitado y un final de amargor suave tostado y seco de madera. Birrote.

[2014] 750ml bottle. Dark brown with a foamy tan head. Flavors are dark fruits, molasses, chocolate, licorice, roasted malts, vanilla, oak, bourbon and brandy. Nice alcohol warmth, but never boozy. Prominent in the aroma, those spirit flavors are more cohesive in mouth. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, smooth texture. A nice treat for a sweet tooth.

Holy crap! Definitely the best of 2015 so far. Pours a purely opaque black with a thick but already dissipating creamy tan head. The nose is pure barrel aroma with sultry brandy notes with rich and complex bourbon aromas. Smoky and earthy with light fruity and roasted notes. An underlying robust malt with heavy espresso and vanilla note swirling into a behemoth of a brew. The first sip is a bit sweet with a milk chocolate likeness that runs into heavy roasted notes and big coffee, licorice and vanilla bean flavours. Smooth and rich barrel notes with mild smoke and toasted flavours. Woody and earthy notes blend together. The finish is heavy with complexity but incredibly smooth and delicate. One of the best beers of my life. The barrel influence is remarkable and impeccable

2014-12-31. Black body with a modest beige head. 3+ Aroma is quite boozy and bourbony. Sweet vanilla character, somewhat overwhelmed dark malt base. Flavour has rich dark malt foundation and good amount of vanilla and bourbon. Simple but lovely. Medium bodied palate, soft to light carbonation. A bit too heavy on the bourbon and booze at times for my tastes but fairly nice overall. Bottle at Volo, Toronto.

Bottle shared with Dany, Rudy, Eric, and my wife at Be Bap in Montreal. Pours a deep black with a thin tan head. Big bourbon and warm wood, hints of cherries and dark stone fruits over dark chocolate. Medium bodied, rich cocoa and sweet wood, chocolate and stone fruit. Cocoa, warm brandy, vanilla and bourbon. Incredibly smooth, chewy, lovely. Alcohol peeks through at the end but quite subtle.
2013 edition. Black with a short tan head. Aroma is oak, vanilla. Boozy and sweet barrel, fruity and sticky. Very good, much better than previous years.

Darkish brown with a good light brown head. Aroma is chocolate, brandy, wood, dates. Full bodied, sweet on the palate with a slightly boozy finish. Taste is dates, raisins, caramel, brandy, hint of chocolate. Nice
Bottle - Boozy barrel notes and dark roast. Jet brown black with a rich beige head. Sweet. Dark malts and nice barrel sweetness. Well balanced, on the sweet side but nice to drink.

Wow, quel délice! Évidemment, le bourbon prend beaucoup de place (normalement, je déteste ces produits qui goûtent trop lalcool fort et peu la bière) mais cest très bien dosé. La vanille est bien présente au nez comme en bouche, appuyée par la café et le caramel. Presque aucune effervescence, à vrai dire quasiment "flat" ;-(
Couleur noir avec quelques reflets brun et un col beige qui se tient bien. Aromes de chocolat noir,café,bois,bourbon, une petite touche sucré qui agrémente le tout. Excellente!

*Bouteille 2014*

À première vue, elle semble dun noir impénétrable, mais on constate éventuellement que la bière est plutôt brune très foncée, avec des petits reflets cuivrés. La mousse est brunâtre et tient très bien la route tout au long de la dégustation. Quel plaisir dy plonger le nez, surtout lorsquon décèle du chocolat au lait, du bois et de lalcool fort. Invitant! En bouche, cet alcool fort se transforme en impression vanillée et juste assez sucrée. Les tannins du bois rehaussent le tout, surtout en finale. Costaude comme bière, elle est toutefois superbement équilibrée. Magique cette bière.
Pours a dark brown to black creamy tan head. Aroma is vanilla and dark fruit. Flavor has sweet alcohol and oak with vanilla and raisins and plums . medium body medium carbonation.

Bouteille 750 ml. 10.5%. Couleur brune-noire, mousse beige-brune. Arôme de bois, alcool, espresso, grains. En bouche, belle rondeur et douceur, notes de fût de bourbon, alcool, bois, bourbob, avec un peu de torréfaction, un peu de cacao. Bel équilibre. Trs bonne.

Bouteille - 750ml. Robe noire et opaque, caractérisée par une faible effervescence et coiffée dun col beige assez épais. Arôme malté/houblonné complexe et puissant. On décèle facilement des notes de bourbon, de brandy et de chêne, ainsi que quelques traces subtiles de vanille et de cacao. Son goût liquoreux est très bien équilibré et porte des nuances deau de vie, de bois, de réglisse noire et de céréales grillées. Lalcool ne se manifeste que dans la longue et costaude finale. Un coup de circuit.

750ml bottle from Broue Ha Ha in Gatineau, Quebec. Vintage 2014. Deep brown in colour with a thin tan coloured head, little lacing. The aroma is of wood, light roast, light chocolate, bourbon. The flavour is more on the brandy side, woody, light alcohol, small roast, some dark fruits. Smooth body. Finishes rather warm, long. Very nicely done.

Brown/black pour with tan head and lace. Aroma is light chocolate, light roasted malt, and a touch of BB. Flavor is semi sweet chocolate, roasted malt, and abv warmth mixed with BB. Medium bodied with good carbonation. solid bp with nice complexity throughout

Near pitch black pour, a thumb of mocha head. Burbon, molasses, roasted malt, dry cherry in arona and taste. Barrel well integrated here allowing dark dry fruits to shine through. Medium to full body.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 Édition 2013 - C?est presque un dessert. Belle apparence noire et opaque. Goût de chocolat noir et bourbon qui apparaît dès qu?on avale. Ce goût tapisse la bouche plusieurs secondes.J?en ai une en réserve pour quelques années!!!!Édition 2014 à venir

Wow, cest intense cette bière là! Je ne suis pas un grand amateur de stouts et, même si cette bière se veut en fait une "lager noire", elle me rappelle immédiatement pourquoi ce type de bière nest pas mon préféré. On dirait un dessert! Cest sucré et bourré de notes de chocolat, de café, de cupcakes. Le vieillissement en fût dalcools forts accentue ces notes de torréfication et en ajoute de nouvelles.

Remarquez, je nai pas dis que ce nétait pas une bonne bière. Je ne doute pas une seconde quelle soit considérée comme une très grande bière par les amateurs du style! Lalcool y est merveilleusement caché et il ny a pas de défaut majeur, si ce nest que de ne pas être dun style que japprécie particulièrement! Bref : recommandée, mais pas pour moi.

Bottle at RBSG 2014, thanks Buckwheat: Sorry my notes on this are very minimal... Brandy, charred oak, vanilla, fig, over-ripened cherry, almond, roast, bakers chocolate. Smooth yet biting finish. Very Nice.
Bottle. Still-mahogany. A-sweet brand, med malt, med/dk fruit. T-follows. Had at GT

Bottle purchased in QC, tasted 04/11/2014. Pours black, fizzy tan head fades quickly to a still surface. Aroma is smooth dark roast and chocolate, sweet grapes and brandy, touch of marshmallow, vanilla, burnt caramel, buttery bourbon, subtle booze. Taste is dark chocolate, dark fruit and berries, brandy, cognac-like notes, toasted dark caramel, bourbon. Brandy helps to balance what might have otherwise been a rough bourbon treatment. Thick, chewy body. Really excellent.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2015 My Bottom Line:
This delicious Barrel-Aged Imperial Porter seduces with its vanilla currents on which surf brandy, peppery wood, fieldberry jam and sturdy caramel.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sliver of foam crowns the brown-edged darkness.
-The finish is laced in luscious residual sugars and mild alcohol warmth.
-The nose is generous in its barrel aromas, but everything is harmonious with the specialty malts.
-Mouthfeel is not obese, but it is definitely thick and rich.

Bottles.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2017 Updated rating last rated back in 2014 bottle A: bourbon, figs, dates, some licorice, a touch of tobacco, dark chocolate, alcohol App: dark like the night smallish beige head t/p: full body with sweet finish of average duration. Velvety texture. O: The blend of this year edition is particularly well done. So much that Im not tempted to age my extra bottles. Im impress!

Dun noir, noir, une mousse qui se résorbe rapidement en un mince voile qui tient cependant la route. Les grains grillés qui frayent au travers des effluves de bourbon. Ya un côté boisé qui, avec les vapeurs dalcool tentent de rendre la mélasse difficilement perceptible. Cest dun velouté charmeur sur la langue. Ça transporte des saveurs sucrées, épicées et de vanille. Cest bien rond. Le résultat est agréable sans que le produit soit tout à fait bonifié, par rapport à loriginal. (999-310114)

Pours nearly black with an inital head that fades to nothing and no lacing. Nose is liqueur and maybe some licorice. Notes of vanilla, espresso, loads of brandy. Taste is big sweet and medium bitter. Oily and sticky mouth with medium carbonation. Nice beer, but a huge brandy bomb.
Riche odeur de café. Broue et dentelle qui durent longtemps. Excellent goût riche, dense de café, chocolat sans amertume. Mmme excellente bière, merci au conseiller de mon dépanneur préféré!

Sample courtesy of a Canadian friend.
Almost no head. Low carbonation. Clear black pour. Lovely brew. Lovely woody brandy notes.

750mL bottle, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks a lot, Dany), pours black with an amber tinge with a small tan head. Aroma brings out loads of complex brandy barrels, subtle bourbon, caramel malt, and candied sugar. Flavour brings out uber-complex notes of equal parts brandy and bourbon, along with decadent caramel notes. Super complex, elegant and amazingly highly drinkable. The ABV is extremely well-hidden, leaving no burn at all. Excellent stuff - even better than the wonderful base beer.

Bouteille de 750 ml, avec bouchon de liège, achetée chez Rahman (Montréal, QC) au coût de 17,25$. Arôme: Odeur de chocolat avec une pointe de cerises. Apparence: La couleur est noire opaque avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col beige mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de chocolat et de petits fruits avec une pointe de raisin et de chêne. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est plein avec une texture onctueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de boisé en arrière goût. (Rating #4946)

750 ml bottle. Pours black with a ruby tint and a short lived beige head. Aroma is chocolate, figs, coffee, wood, liquor. Flavor is dark chocolate, figs, hazelnut, almonds, woody, brandy-bourbon, oak. Finish is booze, dry. Coffeeish bitterness, some brandy notes. Lingering chocolate and liquor. Medium to strong body, sticky and oily mouthfeel, very weak carbonation. Very solid, but it felt like their weakest baltic porter incarnation to date.
The most complex beer I think I have ever tasted. My personal favourite beer for this year. Picked up a case at Bières Du Monde in Aylmer

Out shopping for some Quebec microbrews today and remembered about reading about LTM Baltic Porter. Saw this edition and figured it was worth a try. Absolutely exquisite brew. Great depth and complexity. Bourbon, brandy, vanilla, coffee and chocolate all making for a delicious experience. Must buy a case before I leave Montreal.

Un très élégent produit dans une très élégante bouteille.
Cette Porter Baltique présente un liquide dun noir dencre surmonté dune très fine couche de bulles (plutôt grosses) qui disparaît au bout dune minute, laissant le liquide à vif.
Le nez est subtil: chocolat noir, raisins secs et fruits confits sont les principaux parfums qui en émanent. Nous sommes en droit de nous attendre à un goût également très discret; erreur!
En bouche la Porter Baltique est à la fois vive et ronde. Les saveurs sentremêlent tout en souplesse nous laissant rêver à un magnifique plateau de cacao, de cerises, de poires, Brady... Tout y est. La complexité de cette bière à la fois légère et étonnament ronde me ravit à chaque gorgée.

Nectar du plus noir des noirs, mais relativement mince ; en nez, effluves chocolatées et fruitées (cerises au marasquin, dattes) assorties dune touche de boisé. Effervescence mince. Très puissante en bouche, peut-être un peu trop sucrée, elle développe cependant une panoplie de saveurs qui valsent entre le chocolat à la liqueur, les raisins, les fruits rouges, le chêne, avec juste ce quil faut de tranchant houblonné en finale pour conclure sur la bonne note. À boire lentement et sans exagération, mais elle est un pur délice.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2013 Brown bottle, 750 ml, purchased at Broue Ha Ha, savoured on November 30, 2013; eye: black, opaque, tiny sheet of beige head that turns into a tiny ring, no lacing; nose: bourbon, light woody, roasted malt, molasses, light toffee, slight alcohol, slight ink, light vanilla, plum; mouth: bourbon, light woody, roasted malt, molasses, light toffee, slight alcohol, slight ink, alcohol warmth, light vanilla, plum, finale in bourbon with presence of toffee, full body, below-average carbonation, mildly sweet, lightly alcoholic texture; overall: quite good

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 750 ml, achetée chez Broue Ha Ha, savourée le 30 novembre 2013; il : noire, opaque, petite couverture de mousse beige qui se transforme en un petit anneau, pas de dentelle; nez : bourbon, léger boisé, orge torréfiée, mélasse, léger toffee, très léger alcool, très léger encre, léger vanille, prune; bouche : bourbon, léger boisé, orge torréfiée, mélasse, léger toffee, très léger alcool, très léger encre, chaleur dalcool, léger vanille, prune, finale en bourbon avec présence de toffee, corsée, carbonatation sous la moyenne, moyennement sucrée, texture légèrement alcoolique; en résumé : très bon

750ml bottle, deep black color, with a tan head, but falling quickly, nice sweet bourbon, brandy woody, vanilla, grated coconut nose, with some plummy, chocolate, mocha, espresso coffee, light burnt wood barrel, burnt toast accents, with a chocolate cups filled with bourbon liquor, brownie, chocolate cake, cocoa powder note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a warmth syrupy, boozy bourbonish, brandy, sweet chocolatey, vanilla, faint maple syrup, chocolate cups filled with brandy liqueur, fruity character, with some dark mellow dried fig, plum, dark bitter chocolate baking bar, espresso coffee, mild roasted, chocolate, black, toasted, wheat malty, molasses, brownie flavours, with a faint burnt fruitcake undertone, leading towards a warming, bourbon, brandy liqueur, yeasty, fruity dark dried fig, date, plum, sweet chocolate, mocha, vanilla, woody, lingering mild black, roasted, chocolate maltiness, chocolate chip cookie dough finish.

Pours almost black with reddish hues. Aromas of candied nuts, vanilla, hints of coconut and bourbon. Almost full body, light carbonation, feels a bit cola like on the tongue with big bubbly palate, finishes on the brandy. Did really well paired with a carrot cake!

c est dun noir obscur avec un col qui dure pas c est tres liquoreux comme biere on sens divers aromes tout aussi bon l es un que les autre en premier c est brandy ensuite le chocolat et sa fini par une de bois en bouche c est un mélamge complexe qui est tres réussi c est un mélange liquoreux qui est doux au palais le brandy et bourbon se fusionne avec le chocholat pour terminer une note de bois c est divin c est une grande réussite pour les 3 mousquetaire (rate 147) C EST LA PERFECTION _

Bottle: Poured a dark brown color ale with a rather generous light brown foamy head with good retention and some light lacing. Aroma of warming brandy/bourbon notes with light vanilla with some residual sugar notes is very enticing. Taste is a great mix between some syrupy brandy and bourbon notes with notes of vanilla that are also discernible and some well-balanced residual sugar notes. Body is quite full with great carbonation and light warming alcohol notes are slightly noticeable. I thought this was a great improvement over last year barrel-aged treatment and well-balanced for such an extreme beer.

Des arômes boisé dominé par le bourbon. Les saveurs sont vraiment intense. En premier lieu le bourbon suivie par des saveurs de chocolat, de café et de vanille. une bière complexe qui est un pur délice.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2015 Bière noire qui laisse à peine filtrer quelques reflets rubis à la lumière, effervescence difficile à observer mais qui semble bonne, et surmonté dun col brunâtre pas tellement large, mais bien dense, mousseux et persistant. Arômes dominants de torréfaction (café, chocolat noir et grains brûlés), avec également de la fumée, du boisé, et un alcool assez évident (bourbon et brandy!). On note également quelques effluves de vanille ainsi quun certain fruité (prune et cerise noire). Nez intéressant, mais complexité et intensité plutôt moyennes. En bouche, pétillement tout de même assez élevé sur la langue, onctuosité exceptionnelle au palais, breuvage lourd, moelleux et velouté, rondeur incroyable! Au goût, le malt torréfié est moins présent quau nez, et on est davantage dans les sucres foncés (mélasse, caramel, érable, chocolat au lait). Saveurs également de fumée, vanille, boisé et alcool (bourbon et brandy!), avec le fruité (prune et crise noire) un peu plus en retrait. Comparé à la version originale, on semble perdre pas mal de fruité au profit du boisé et de lalcool. Finale principalement boisée et alcoolisée présentant tout de même une amertume légère mais bien sentie. Excellente intégration des différentes saveurs, excellent équilibre entre le sucré et le boisé/alcool, complexité et intensité heureusement bien plus élevées quau nez. Ce porter baltique édition spéciale est excellent, mais je préfère néanmoins la version originale.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours black (very dark brown) with medium beige head. Aroma is of green stuff/weird resin, roasted malt, alcohol, chocolate, dark fruits. Taste is of sugar, sweet, brandy, alcohol, fruits. Bananas. Somewhat messy. Incredibly too sugary (we talking full tablespoons too many/glass). Palate: Full bodied. Sticky. Low carb. Overall: Would be interesting, but as it is, its far too sugary/cloying, in several ways. Very boozy. Still not a total fail for sure.

Bottle. Dark red-brown pour with vanishing brown head. Oaky aroma, tons and tons of wood, vegetal (?) notes, vanilla, pear, winey/port like aroma too, banana, lots of stuff going on, very intense. Flavor is sweet, very woody, boozy and diabetic-coma-inducing sweet, very messy. Palate is oily, very thin carbonation. Aroma is interesting, but it falls apart somewhat beyond that. Unfortunately, these barrel-aged variations cant hold a candle to the original baltic porter that has always been a personal favorite of mine.

pours intensely dark brown without a head. booze, rum-soaked raisins, coconut, burnt caramel, pepper, molasses and demerara, warming bourbon, perfume, few bananas and apples - calvados and brandy-like fruity esters or off-flavors - anyhow, it doesnt quite blend in well. low carbonation, almost flat that is, medium body - oily, syrupy, roasted and über-cloying finish. complex brew but the baltic porter underneath is clearly overshadowed by barrel treatments. o-k.

A tous ceux qui rate cette bière basse vous êtes ds me champs .cette est d un équilibre parfait ,elle est tout simplement incroyablement bien balancé . On y retrouve une harmonie parfaite entre le bourbon et le brandy ni l un ni l autre prends le dessus. Elle ne fait qu améliorer la version originale sans la défaire non plus .

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2013 Pours a dark brown with no head (well, technically there was one but retention is bad on this one) so no lacing. Aroma is woody, a bit fruity and full of spirits (a nice way of saying that alcohol was pretty much "in your face"). Taste is again boozy and really sweet (I wouldnt drink a whole 750 of this and I LOVE sweet and boozy sippers). Flavors of chocolate and vanilla mostly. Some weird "green" notes, tart and apple cider-like. Booze is killing this one IMO. Body is kinda thin, well, thinner than one would expect. Carbonation was low and the alcohol bites plenty. Not too sure what to think of this one judging from the scores entered previously but this is inferior to a lot of the great strong ales out there (but still really good, mind you). Might be a good cellaring experience...

Bottle (750 ml). Dark brown with reddish reflects, light brown head and little to no lacing. Aroma is of wood (so much wood!), vanilla, coconut, brandy, booziness, green-ish notes and a lot of sweetness. Taste is extremely sweet (cloying) with, again, a ton of wood, vanilla, coconut, alcohol, brandy, Welch grape juice and red fruits. Weird body... heavy because of the sweetness/booze, but kind of thin too... not consistent. Low carbonation. Lately, I was kind of impressed by LTMs DIPA, but this one is a big letdown. Its incredibly overrated by homers, overly sweet and boozy. This is really complex, but it doesnt get together at all so its kind of a useless complexity. I dont think it will get any better with age. Aroma is ok, but the taste is just too much. I understand that it is a sipper, but we splitted it 7 ways and at least 5 of us were not able to finish their glass and there was still 100 ml in the bottle.

Pour is dark brown with little brown head and little to no lacing. Aroma is boozy, lots of oak tannins, some dark fruits, some tart notes, not very appealing. Taste is very boozy, too sweet, greenish, grapes, oak, coconut. Seriously, I was expecting more of this and it's a big let down. I have a hard time finishing my glass.... And it's a small one.

Ce porter a vieilli quatre mois dans des fûts de chêne de bourbon et de brandy.
Lorsque lon ouvre la bouteille, une odeur de vanille nous envahie le nez, cest déjà enivrant. En la versant dans le verre, il y presque pas de mousse, un simple liquide brun hyper foncé sort de la bouteille. Au nez, la vanille est encore présente, mais il y a aussi la présence de chocolat et de cerise noire.
Au goût, cest vraiment un délice. On retrouve la vanille, qui provient du vieillissement en fût de bourdon, et la cerise, qui est dû au fût de brandy. Pour une bière à 10.5%, lalcool nest pas présent. On a aussi un liquide qui est bien épais en bouche avec peu deffervescence.
Cest vraiment un produit exceptionnel. Elle est supérieure à bien des bières vieillies en fût. En terminant, cette bière se boit comme un porto, dont elle fait dailleurs penser: Boisée, sucrée.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2014 Bouteille 750ml, 2013. Couleur noire opaque, voile de mousse moka fuyante. Arôme boisé, bourbon, malt torréfié, cigare. Goût boisé, bourbon, malt torréfié, sucré, pointe dalcool, chocolat au lait en arrière-goût. Carbonation moyenne-faible, corps dense, collante. Excellente, comme la plupart des produits de LTM!

Bière noire, peu mousseuse et peu effervescente. Le nez est boisé et abondamment parfumé dalcool de chocolat et de bourbon. En bouche, une touche vanillée ouvre le bal des saveurs : sirop de chocolat noir, café, bourbon (et brandy évidemment)... Mon palais est tout de bois construit! Cette version du Porter Baltique (qui est déjà sublime à son état régulier) est simplement divine. Personnellement, je pourrais difficilement imaginer mieux. Mais javais dit la même chose lan dernier. Parions quAlex se surpassera lan prochain. Qui sait, peut-être lui offrirai-je ma première note parfaite de «5» sur RateBeer. (Oui Alex, cest un défi!)
UPDATED: DEC 3, 2013 Un liquide intensément onctueux qui respire la vanille et les petits fruits macérés dans le brandy. Cest une version assurément mieux conçue que les premiers essais.

Une bouteille partagée en 4. Un liquide bien ténébreux qui ne présente aucune construction mousseuse. Dans mon verre, des arômes de café, de chocolat et de choses sucrées fortement imbibés par des parfums de bourbon et par des vapeurs dune eau-de-vie fruitée. Sur les papilles, une amertume foncée et un alcool qui me fait avancer à petites gorgées. En bouche, un liquide qui ne possède pas le corps souhaité. En finale, des notes longuement noires et amères qui, malheureusement, massomment considérablement.  Ouf... Cette bière nest pas du tout facile à boire.  Certainement, nous sommes, par la nature même du liquide, ailleurs que sur le territoire du concept de la buvabilité.  En ce qui me concerne, un flacon de 25 cl partagé en 4 aurait été bien suffisant.

Its on of those beers. The baltic porter is a favorite of mine and its already of the of the best product I know of so my expectations are always high for their special editions. Fortunately they rarely disapoint. 

The 2010 special edition was really majestic. The 2011 was a bit of a let down consiering they aged their beed in bourbon barrels already used once for the 2010. 

The 2013 special edition is probably the best of the three. Its definitely sweeter. You can taste the bourbon but the brandy is not completely absent. 

There is nothing else to say if you already know the baltic porter. ITs the same product with a little bit more character. Its almost a perfect beer and if you see it, buy it, you will have no regrets.
